abstract.text: Generic structure for accessing theming declarations parsed from JSON files.

inlineContent.text: acts as a dynamic gateway to various theming categories, such as colors, fonts, metrics, images, typography, and button styles etc..
, it allows seamless access to declared values while providing robust fallback mechanisms.
The following type aliases extend the base
for various UI components, making it easier to manage and resolve specific design tokens in a consistent and scalable way:
Responsible for managing and resolving color tokens. This includes static colors and dynamic system colors, supporting light/dark mode.
Manages font tokens, such as font families and sizes. Enables consistent typography across the app by centralizing font definitions.
Handles numeric tokens, such as spacing, corner radius, border widths. Useful for creating a consistent design language with reusable measurements.
Manages image tokens. Supports bitmap assets for different scenarios.
Manages typography tokens, combining font and size. Provides full control over how text styles are applied in the app.
Handles a set of colors representing interaction states, such as
. Useful for managing button states, toggle switches, and other interactive elements.
Manages button style tokens, including properties like surface and text colors, border widths and color, shape and typography for various button states.
Manages shape tokens, defining the appearance of button outlines, such as circular, rounded rectangle, or custom shapes.
Manages shape style tokens, including support for gradients such as linear, radial, and angular, enabling the creation of dynamic and visually appealing shape backgrounds.
Manages segment control style tokens, enabling the customization of segment control appearance, including selected/unselected states, borders, shapes, and paddings.
Handles slider style tokens, managing properties like track colors, tick mark styles for sliders used in the UI.
Manages toggle style tokens, allowing control over the appearance of toggles, such as colors for enabled/disabled states.

abstract.text: Manages slider-style tokens, including track colors and tick mark styles for sliders utilized in the user interface.
Initializes animation declarations with caching and configuration options.

value using a dynamic key path.
The configuration object associated with the theming declarations.
Contains fallback values and settings required to resolve tokens and define theming behavior.
Manages gradient tokens, supporting linear, radial, and angular gradients. This enables the creation of dynamic and visually appealing shape backgrounds.
Responsible for managing and resolving color tokens, including static colors and dynamic system colors, with support for light/dark mode.
Cache containing resolved theming tokens.
This cache stores the resolved values for easy retrieval, based on the root key and associated declared values.
Initializes a
object for colors, optionally using a cached color representation.
Manages typography tokens, combining font and size. Offers complete control over how text styles are applied within the application.
Keys available for theming declarations.
These keys represent specific theming values in the cache that can be accessed dynamically.
Resolves a declared value dynamically based on a key path

with a cache of tokens and a configuration.
Manages button styles, including properties such as surface and text colors, border widths and colors, shapes, and typography for various button states.
Initializes the declarations for themed images.
Manages numerical tokens, including spacing, corner radius, and border widths. This functionality facilitates the creation of a consistent design language with reusable measurements.
Handles a set of colors representing interaction states, such as

. Useful for managing button states, toggle switches, and other interactive elements.
Dynamically resolves an image using a key path.
Initializes the declarations for themed metrics.
Manages button shape tokens, defining the appearance of button outlines, such as circular, rounded rectangle, or custom shapes.
Manages segment control style tokens, allowing customization of segment control appearance, including selected/unselected states, borders, shapes, and paddings.

instance.
Manages toggle style tokens, providing control over the visual representation of toggles, including color schemes for the enabled and disabled states.
Framework for parsing design theme declarations from JSON.
The resolver used to resolve tokens into concrete representations of the declared values.
Provides a mechanism to interpret and transform them based on the associated configuration.
Generic structure for accessing theming declarations parsed from JSON files.
Manages font tokens, including font families and sizes. Enables consistent typography across the application by centralizing font definitions.
Accesses the animation value dynamically by a key path.
Dynamically resolves a metric value using a key path.
Accesses the shape style corresponding to the given key path.
